info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:24PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Elkins, or 36 miles northeast of Roswell. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Chaves County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
